basics.name: Xiaochuan Zha (Tran)
basics.label: Engineering Manager
basics.summary: Love to make things happen and make them work. Build, nurture and empower teams to deliver and own sofware applications. Balance between product lead and tech lead; pragmatic and disruptive thinking. Architect and develop web based and cloud hosted applications using modern technologies and patterns.

work.name: LMG - replatform MyCRM core
work.summary: LMG is investing into new type of loans, with ambition to expand into all financial services in future too. MyCRM's current architecture and data schema is no longer fit for purpose. The team is in charge of building a new core with necessary new patterns to solve this problem.
highlights: Step into a non-performing team and turn it around
Dealing with conflicts and hugely different personalities
Driving cross department conversations and alignments
Re-aligning expectations, internal and external
Driving balance between tech lead and product lead
Building technical roadmap
Exploration in event-sourcing and tranistion required from tranditional data storages

work.name: LMG - one commission system
work.summary: Not long after the acquisition of Podium, paying out broker commissions to all different types of arragements becomes a huge problem. The commissions processing team keeps expanding, but it is a not a long term solution. Time for 1 system to rule them all.
highlights: Building a new tech team from sratch
Discovery of multiple decades old systems and processes
Making plans and business cases to drive for internal investments
Roadmap and capacity planning for the new system

work.name: LMG - business insights
work.summary: Reporting is always a short-fall of MyCRM, it never had enough focus because of other workarounds. It can't be overlooked any more, with the expanding user base LMG has now.
highlights: Working with multiple external vendors - Snowflake, Starburst, ThoughtSpot, BigQuery, Sisence, etc.
Comparing vendors from various angles, including architecture pillars around them
Fail fast on quick POCs and MVPs
Separation of data lake and data warehouse for reporting
Building data extraction, ingestion and transformation pipelines, and accounts for multiple environments
Overnight processing and real-time processing of various data sources, from databases to spreadsheets

work.name: LMG - risk insurance uplift
work.summary: Risk insurance has been left out in the platform upgrades for a long time. This includes both the basic CRM stuff like pipelines and workflow automations, also the sales tools like profiling, quoting and online applications. To avoid making more patches and tweaks, an across the board uplift is required.
highlights: Adopting Shape Up agile methodology
Individual career development
Empowering teams for ownership and encourage collaborations
Smooth user transitions and data migrations

work.name: LMG - the Podium acquisition
work.summary: LMG acquired a few other aggregators, along with their CRM system Podium. The decision has been made to migrate everyone from Podium to MyCRM, of course given that we can uplift the missing features and able to carry out the massive data migrations. This team is in charge of the data migrations, for both broker users and corporate users.
highlights: Working with teams of different cultures
Building one-off and overnight deltas data migration pipeline
Combining different technologies and vendors, including SSIS, TaskFactory, Salesforce, Kubernetes jobs and variuos AWS services

work.name: LMG - replatform infrastructure
work.summary: MyCRM is fully in AWS, but we're still hosting using Windows servers and IIS in year 2019. To allow better scaling, and more importantly better supporting the transition from Monolith to multiple services, we need a better solution - namely Kubernetes or EKS in AWS. Also, the ability to trace issues in production, especially performance issues are unncessarily complex, can we make it better?
highlights: Kubernetes with EKS, set up and transit existing applications to the cluster
OpenTelemetry ingestion for traces and metrics, contextual logging
Transition frontend, backend and database into a uniform CI/CD toolset - Github Actions and Octopus
Excessive amount of bash scripting
Local development F5 experience

work.name: NZFSG - launch MyCRM and migrations
work.summary: NZFSG is a subsidiary company under LMG, but the in-house built CRM system, MyCRM, is getting attention in Australia. The project is to rebuild MyCRM into a modern system, account for Australian brokers and processes, also migrate everyone to it.
highlights: Migration from on-prem to cloud (AWS)
Redesigning parts of application to fit for cloud services
Integrating various monitoring tools including Dynatrace, cloud watch, StatusCake, etc.
Implementing CI/CD combining 3rd party services (AppVeyor, CircleCI, RedGate) as well as cloud service
Data migrations across the board for multiple systems
Adopting NodeJS and Serverless stack for non user facing parts
Coordinating security audit by PWC
Assiting major off-shore development team expansion, 0 to 20+ in months
Agile methodology and Certified Scrum Master
Big launch date

work.name: LifeDirect / Inform Holdings Ltd / Trade Me
work.summary: Multiple rounds of being acquired, acquiring other companies and spin-offs. Expansion from 1-person team to leading a small team.
highlights: LifeDirect online risk insurance platform, from quoting to apply to underwriting
Admin portals and reporting system for internal usage
MyCRM project for NZFSG - company acquired, CRM built, then sold
Fullstack from HTML/CSS/Javascript to C# and SQL
On-premise hosting and operations
Onboarding new team member, mentoring and knowledge transfers

references.name: Andrew Brown
references.reference: CTO - 2020~2023 - contact details are available on request

references.name: James Punnett
references.reference: Managing Director - 2008~2019 - contact details are available on request
